intro: Trixis pallida var. australis, commonly known as the Australian trixis, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Australia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30 centimeters, featuring slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pale yellow to white flowers during the autumn season. It is adapted to dry conditions and has a deep root system to access water from deeper soil layers. Trixis pallida var. australis is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in native gardens.
